item.title: Item-Wise and Distribution-Wise Matching
item.description: “Words were controlled between conditions for frequency and length (all F values < 1).” How many times have you read a paper with a sentence like this in the Materials section? My pet hate is when papers try to show that stimuli are controlled by reporting non-significant p values from t-tests or ANOVAs on the differences in confounds between conditions. This is a problem because of: Statistical reasons: They’re assuming normality in the distributions.
